conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true cutaway 3D isometric: walls have height and thickness, multiple faces are visible, and interiors are exposed via roof/ceiling removal.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion with clear wall thickness, readable room volumes, correct angled view, and clean cutaway; only minor simplifications at some corners/edges.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room count and main adjacencies largely match (living area top, bedrooms bottom corners, closet top-left, entry/hall bottom-center), but the kitchen/cabinet run appears relocated to the right wall in the 3D render versus the 2D plan’s kitchen placement along the left/inner side near the closet/living boundary, indicating a notable layout deviation.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture is present (sofas, dining table, beds) and bathrooms include key fixtures; kitchen elements exist but their placement relative to the 2D plan is inconsistent.

visual_clarity.notes: Geometry is generally clean and readable with good lighting; however, prominent text labels inside the 3D render reduce presentation clarity and count as UI contamination.

detected_errors.description: Kitchen geometry/furnishing run is positioned on a different wall in the 3D render compared with the 2D plan, causing a significant layout fidelity issue.
Text labels are embedded in the 3D render (room names/annotations), reducing presentation cleanliness.
Some door swing/orientation and opening proportions appear simplified and may not exactly match the 2D plan.

summary: A clearly valid cutaway 3D conversion with strong volumetric execution, but with a notable kitchen placement/layout deviation and minor presentation/annotation issues.
